episodeTitle: Collapsing Upper Ruins! The Quintet for the Finale!
episodeTitleJapanese: 崩れゆく上層遺跡！終曲（フィナーレ）への五重奏（クインテット）！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kuzure Yuku Jōsō Iseki! Fināre e no Kuintetto!!
description: As the survival game nears its climax, the upper ruins of Shandora collapse, sending the remaining fighters tumbling to the legendary City of Gold. Enel appears before the final survivors, revealing his deadly game's prediction, while Nami and Gan Fall escape from Nola's belly and Conis rushes to warn Angel Island of Enel's destructive plans.

events.title: Nami and Gan Fall Escape Nola's Belly
events.description: Nami and Gan Fall successfully escape from inside the giant snake Nola's belly. They emerge through Nola's mouth aboard the waver, finally free from the serpent that had swallowed them earlier in the survival game.
events.significance: Marks the escape of two key survivors from one of the major threats of the survival game, allowing them to continue toward the final confrontation with Enel.

quotes.text: We made it out! That was way too close!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's relief after escaping from Nola

events.title: Gan Fall Sends Pierre to Rescue Luffy and Aisa
events.description: After escaping Nola, Gan Fall realizes that Luffy and Aisa are still trapped inside the giant snake. He makes the difficult decision to send his loyal companion Pierre back into danger to rescue them from within Nola's belly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Gan Fall's selfless character and commitment to saving everyone, even at the risk of losing his closest companion. This decision proves crucial for Luffy's survival.

quotes.text: Pierre, go back! You must help Luffy and the girl escape!
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Gan Fall orders Pierre to return to Nola to save Luffy and Aisa

events.title: Conis Resolves to Warn Angel Island
events.description: After learning about Enel's plan to destroy all of Skypiea, Conis makes the courageous decision to leave Upper Yard and rush to Angel Island to warn the inhabitants of the impending catastrophe, despite the mortal danger of defying Enel.
events.significance: Marks Conis's transformation from a frightened citizen to a brave hero willing to risk her life to save others. This decision will directly impact the survival of Skypiea's population.

quotes.text: I have to warn everyone! I can't let them all die without knowing what's coming!
quotes.speaker: Conis
quotes.context: Conis's determination to warn Angel Island despite the danger

events.title: Conis Leaves Su to Watch Over Sanji and Usopp
events.description: Before departing for Angel Island, Conis instructs her cloud fox Su to stay behind and watch over the unconscious Sanji and Usopp, ensuring they are protected while she's away on her dangerous mission.
events.significance: Shows Conis's care for the Straw Hats and her strategic thinking in ensuring all bases are covered. Su becomes the guardian of two key crew members.

events.title: Zoro Reflects on His Battle with Ohm
events.description: After defeating Priest Ohm, Zoro acknowledges that he needs more training, particularly with the powerful attack he used to break through Ohm's iron cloud defenses. This self-reflection demonstrates his commitment to continuous improvement.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's character growth and his understanding that despite winning, he must continue to train and refine his techniques. This mindset will drive his future development.

quotes.text: I still need more training. That attack took too much out of me.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's self-assessment after defeating Ohm

events.title: Enel Uses Sango to Destroy the Upper Ruins
events.description: Enel unleashes his lightning technique Sango, sending devastating electrical waves throughout the upper ruins. Unlike his precise El Thor strikes, Sango is a wide-area attack that indiscriminately destroys everything in its path, causing the entire upper level structure to begin collapsing.
events.significance: First demonstration of Enel's wide-area destruction technique, showcasing the terrifying scope of his power. This attack forces all remaining fighters to descend to Shandora, setting up the final confrontation.

quotes.text: Sango! Let the ruins crumble and summon all who remain to the true battleground!
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel destroys the upper ruins with his lightning attack

events.title: Enel Reveals Sango as an Invitation
events.description: Enel explains to Robin that his Sango attack was not merely destruction for its own sake, but a calculated invitation to summon all the remaining survivors to Shandora, the true ruins where the final stage of his game will take place.
events.significance: Demonstrates Enel's strategic mind and his god-like control over the survival game. He's orchestrating every movement of the players to his desired conclusion.

quotes.text: That was an invitation. I'm summoning everyone to this stage for the finale.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel reveals his strategic purpose for the Sango attack

events.title: The Survivors Fall to Shandora
events.description: As the upper ruins collapse from Enel's Sango attack, Zoro, Robin, Wyper, and Gan Fall all tumble down through the destruction and land in the ancient ruins of Shandora - the legendary City of Gold that has been hidden beneath Upper Yard for 400 years.
events.significance: Major reveal of Shandora's location and the convergence of all key players in the same location for the arc's climax. The ancient city becomes the stage for the final battles.

events.title: Zoro and Robin Reunite in Shandora
events.description: After falling from the upper ruins, Zoro lands near Robin in Shandora. Confused about their location, Zoro asks Robin where they are, and she reveals they've reached the place they were searching for - the ancient ruins containing the City of Gold.
events.significance: Reunites two key Straw Hat members and confirms they've reached their original objective. Robin's knowledge becomes crucial for understanding their location's significance.

quotes.text: Where the hell are we?
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro asking Robin about their location after landing

quotes.text: This is the place we were searching for - the ancient ruins of Shandora, the City of Gold.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin revealing their location to Zoro

events.title: Discovery That Shandora's Gold is Gone
events.description: Upon examining the ancient ruins of Shandora, the survivors discover that despite the city's legendary reputation as the City of Gold, there is no gold remaining. Enel has already plundered all of Shandora's treasures for his own purposes.
events.significance: Reveals that Enel has been systematically looting Shandora's wealth, explaining where he obtained the gold for his ark Maxim. This discovery adds urgency to stopping Enel before he escapes with Sky Island's heritage.

quotes.text: The City of Gold... but where's all the gold?
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Realizing Shandora has been stripped of its treasures

events.title: Wyper Realizes He's Landed on Shandora
events.description: After falling from the upper ruins, Wyper recognizes that he has landed on Shandora - the ancestral homeland of the Shandia people that his tribe has been fighting to reclaim for 400 years. The realization fills him with emotion and renewed determination.
events.significance: Deeply personal moment for Wyper as he finally reaches the sacred land his ancestors have fought to protect for centuries. This grounds the conflict in the Shandia's historical struggle.

quotes.text: This is... Shandora. I've finally reached our homeland.
quotes.speaker: Wyper
quotes.context: Wyper recognizing the ancestral city of the Shandia

events.title: Nola Recognizes Shandora and Sheds a Tear
events.description: The giant snake Nola, having lived for over 400 years, recognizes the ruins of Shandora as her ancient home from when it was still part of Jaya. Overcome with emotion at seeing her ancestral homeland, the ancient creature sheds a single tear.
events.significance: Poignant moment connecting Nola to the ancient history of Jaya and Shandora. Reveals that Nola is old enough to remember the city before it was blasted into the sky, adding depth to the arc's themes of lost history and homecoming.

events.title: Enel Attacks Nola with El Thor
events.description: Annoyed by Nola's emotional display and presence, Enel unleashes his signature El Thor technique - a massive lightning bolt from the sky - striking the giant snake with devastating force. The attack electrocutes Nola, knocking the ancient creature unconscious.
events.significance: Demonstrates Enel's callous cruelty toward even ancient creatures of Sky Island. The attack also traps Luffy and Aisa inside the unconscious Nola, creating a new complication for the heroes.

quotes.text: Your tears bore me. El Thor!
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel attacking Nola with his lightning

events.title: Luffy and Aisa Trapped in Unconscious Nola
events.description: When Enel's El Thor attack knocks Nola unconscious, Luffy and Aisa are trapped inside the snake's belly. With Nola knocked out, they cannot escape through her mouth as planned, leaving them helpless inside while the final confrontation begins outside.
events.significance: Creates a critical obstacle preventing Luffy from immediately confronting Enel. This delay builds tension and forces the other fighters to face Enel without the Straw Hat captain's help.

events.title: Enel Confronts the Final Four Survivors
events.description: Enel appears before Zoro, Robin, Wyper, and Gan Fall in the ruins of Shandora. He greets them calmly, acknowledging that these four warriors represent the strongest survivors who have made it to the final stage of his deadly survival game.
events.significance: Epic confrontation moment that brings together the arc's main antagonist with the four strongest fighters still standing. Sets up the climactic battles to come.

quotes.text: Welcome to the final stage. Only the strongest have made it this far.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel greeting the four survivors who reached Shandora

events.title: Enel Reveals the Survival Game Numbers
events.description: Enel explains to the gathered survivors that his game began with numerous participants including himself, and according to his calculations, exactly five people should remain after three hours. However, he reveals that he's aware of Nami's presence, meaning there are currently six survivors instead of his predicted five.
events.significance: Reveals the mathematical precision of Enel's deadly game and his god-like omniscience through Mantra (Observation Haki). The discrepancy of six survivors instead of five creates tension about who will be eliminated.

quotes.text: My prediction was perfect - five should remain. But there are six of you. Someone will have to go.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel revealing the survival game numbers and the discrepancy

events.title: Enel Offers a Choice: Fight Each Other or Face Him
events.description: Enel presents the four survivors with a twisted choice: they can either fight amongst themselves to reduce their numbers to his prediction, or he will choose their opponents for them. He frames this as a generous offer, giving them agency in his game.
events.significance: Demonstrates Enel's sadistic nature and his enjoyment of manipulating others. His offer tests the survivors' unity and reveals his confidence that he can defeat anyone regardless of their choice.

quotes.text: I'll give you a choice. Fight amongst yourselves, or I'll pick your opponents. Either way, the numbers must match my prediction.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel's offer to the survivors

events.title: The Four Survivors Unite Against Enel
events.description: In response to Enel's offer, all four survivors - Zoro, Robin, Wyper, and Gan Fall - unanimously reject his choice. Despite their different backgrounds and previous conflicts, they unite with a common declaration: Enel will be the one who disappears, not them.
events.significance: Powerful moment of unity that transcends previous conflicts between pirates, Shandia warriors, and Sky Island knights. Establishes that Enel is the true enemy everyone must defeat together. This alliance sets up the final battle.

quotes.text: We refuse your choice. You're the one who will fall here!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: The survivors' united rejection of Enel's offer

quotes.text: We may have fought each other before, but you're the real threat to everyone.
quotes.speaker: Wyper
quotes.context: Wyper acknowledging the need to unite against Enel

quotes.text: Pierre, go back! You must help Luffy and the girl escape!
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Gan Fall's selfless decision to send Pierre back into danger

quotes.text: I have to warn everyone! I can't let them all die without knowing what's coming!
quotes.speaker: Conis
quotes.context: Conis's courageous decision to warn Angel Island

quotes.text: Sango! Let the ruins crumble and summon all who remain to the true battleground!
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel unleashing his wide-area lightning attack

quotes.text: This is the place we were searching for - the ancient ruins of Shandora, the City of Gold.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin revealing their location to Zoro

quotes.text: This is... Shandora. I've finally reached our homeland.
quotes.speaker: Wyper
quotes.context: Wyper's emotional recognition of his ancestral homeland

quotes.text: My prediction was perfect - five should remain. But there are six of you. Someone will have to go.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel revealing the survival game numbers discrepancy

quotes.text: We refuse your choice. You're the one who will fall here!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: The survivors uniting against Enel

themes.description: The episode culminates in former enemies - pirates, Shandia warriors, and Sky Knights - uniting against Enel's tyrannical rule. Their unified rejection of his sadistic game represents the power of cooperation against oppression.
themes.symbolism: Shandora itself symbolizes the unity theme, as it's the common heritage that brings together both Shandia and Sky Islanders, revealing their shared history.

themes.theme: Courage in the Face of Overwhelming Power
themes.description: Multiple characters demonstrate extraordinary courage this episode: Conis risks her life to warn strangers, Gan Fall sacrifices his companion to save others, and the four survivors dare to challenge a self-proclaimed god.
themes.symbolism: The collapsing upper ruins represent the crumbling of fear and the descent to the truth - both literally to Shandora and metaphorically to confronting the real enemy.

themes.description: The reveal of Shandora connects to the arc's overarching theme of reclaiming lost history. Both Wyper and Nola experience emotional moments recognizing their ancient homeland, highlighting the deep connection between place and identity.
themes.symbolism: Nola's tear represents the sorrow of 400 years of separation from home, while the empty City of Gold symbolizes how heritage can be stolen but the significance of the place remains.

themes.description: Enel's calculated manipulation of the survival game contrasts with the survivors' assertion of their own agency. His offer of choice is revealed as hollow when the survivors reject his entire framework.
themes.symbolism: The 'quintet' (five survivors) represents Enel's attempt to control destiny through calculation, while the actual six survivors represent the unpredictability of human will.
culturalReferences: The episode title's musical reference to 'quintet' echoes classical music terminology, suggesting Enel sees himself as a conductor orchestrating a deadly performance

characterSpotlights.development: Enel's godlike confidence and strategic mind are on full display. His Sango attack demonstrates his overwhelming power, while his survival game calculations reveal his belief in his own omniscience. His casual cruelty toward Nola and manipulative offer to the survivors establish him as a truly terrifying villain.
keyActions: Unleashes Sango to destroy the upper ruins
Attacks Nola with El Thor
Confronts the four survivors in Shandora
Reveals his survival game prediction and the discrepancy
Offers the survivors a choice to fight each other
quotes: Sango! Let the ruins crumble and summon all who remain!
My prediction was perfect - five should remain. But there are six of you.

characterSpotlights.development: Conis undergoes a heroic transformation, evolving from a frightened citizen into someone willing to risk death to save others. Her decision to warn Angel Island despite knowing Enel's punishment demonstrates remarkable courage.
keyActions: Resolves to warn Angel Island of Enel's plans
Leaves Su to protect Sanji and Usopp
Departs for her dangerous mission
quotes: I have to warn everyone! I can't let them all die without knowing what's coming!

characterSpotlights.development: Wyper's arrival at Shandora is deeply personal - he's finally reached the sacred homeland his people have fought to reclaim for 400 years. His willingness to ally with former enemies shows growth beyond tribal vengeance.
keyActions: Falls to Shandora from the upper ruins
Recognizes his ancestral homeland
Unites with Zoro, Robin, and Gan Fall against Enel
quotes: This is... Shandora. I've finally reached our homeland.
We may have fought each other before, but you're the real threat to everyone.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro shows maturity in recognizing his need for more training despite his victory over Ohm. His immediate willingness to unite with former enemies against Enel demonstrates his practical combat sense and leadership qualities.
keyActions: Reflects on his battle with Ohm
Falls to Shandora and reunites with Robin
Takes the lead in rejecting Enel's offer
Unites with the other survivors
quotes: I still need more training. That attack took too much out of me.
We refuse your choice. You're the one who will fall here!

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's knowledge proves crucial in identifying Shandora and understanding its significance. Her calm presence in the face of Enel's threat and willingness to stand with the others shows her growing investment in the crew's mission.
keyActions: Listens to Enel's explanation of the Sango attack
Reunites with Zoro in Shandora
Reveals their location as the ancient City of Gold
Stands united with the other survivors against Enel
quotes: This is the place we were searching for - the ancient ruins of Shandora, the City of Gold.

characterSpotlights.development: Gan Fall demonstrates selfless heroism by sending his beloved companion Pierre into danger to save Luffy and Aisa. His willingness to work with both pirates and Shandia shows his wisdom and prioritization of the greater good.
keyActions: Escapes Nola with Nami
Sends Pierre back to rescue Luffy and Aisa
Falls to Shandora
Unites with the others against Enel
quotes: Pierre, go back! You must help Luffy and the girl escape!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several action sequences showing the survivors falling through the collapsing ruins, adding more dramatic visual impact to their descent to Shandora.
Additional reaction shots of Nola shedding a tear upon recognizing Shandora were added in the anime to emphasize the emotional weight of the moment.
The anime added more dialogue between Zoro and Robin when they reunite, giving additional context to their situation.

trivia.fact: The episode title 'Quintet for the Finale' references a musical ensemble of five musicians, paralleling Enel's prediction of five survivors. However, the actual count is six, symbolizing how the survivors are disrupting Enel's 'perfect' orchestration.
This episode adapts material from manga chapters 272 (pages 14-18) and 273 (pages 2-19), covering approximately 1.3 chapters of content.
Nola's emotional tear upon recognizing Shandora is significant because the snake has lived for over 400 years and actually remembers when Shandora was part of Jaya before being blasted into the sky.
The technique 'Sango' (珊瑚) literally means 'coral' in Japanese, possibly referencing the branching pattern of lightning similar to coral formations.
Voice actor Kazuya Nakai voices both Roronoa Zoro and Pierre in the Japanese version, requiring him to switch between a serious warrior and a comic relief bird in the same episode.
This episode marks the first major reveal of Shandora's location beneath the Upper Yard, a mystery that has been building since the arc began in episode 143.
